To help you learn about new features and configuration options, this topic will receive messages about important changes in Zulip.

You can read these update messages whenever it's convenient, or mute this topic if you are not interested. If your organization does not want to receive these announcements, they can be disabled. Learn more.

• You can now upload large files up to 1 GB in organizations on Zulip Cloud Standard or Zulip Cloud Plus plans.

Web and desktop updates

  • You can now start a new conversation from the left sidebar. Click the + button next to the name of a channel to start a new topic in that channel, or the + next to DIRECT MESSAGES to start a DM.
  • The user list now shows recent participants in the conversation you're viewing.

• Most permissions in Zulip can now be granted to any combination of roles, groups, and individual users. Previously, permissions were configurable only by user role.
  • Creating new user groups now requires a Zulip Cloud Standard or Zulip Cloud Plus plan.

Web and desktop updates

  • To provide more information, long topic names are now shown on two lines in the left sidebar.
  • Pasted message links are now automatically converted into nicely formatted links.

• Zulip’s next-gen mobile app is now in public beta. If offers a sleek new design and a faster, smoother experience. Check out the announcement post for details and instructions on how to try the beta!

Web and desktop updates

  • There's a new option to show avatars in the user list.
  • You can now conveniently forward a message to another conversation from the message menu.

Not sure where to put this,... glad you moved to Zulip!

• When you link to a topic in Zulip, that link will now continue to work even when the topic is renamed, moved to another channel, or resolved.

Web and desktop updates

  • You can now save snippets of message content, and quickly insert them into the message you're composing.
  • Drafts are no longer removed after 30 days.

• Zulip channels have a new space for chatting without a topic (e.g., social chatter or one-off requests). Channel messages sent without a topic (if allowed in your organization) now go to a special “general chat” topic. Its name appears in italics, and will be translated into your language.
  • New channel permission settings let administrators delegate channel management responsibilities. There are settings for who can administer each channel, and who can subscribe and unsubscribe other users. You can also give users and groups permission to read and subscribe to a private channel, just like everyone other than guests can do with public channels.

Web and desktop updates

  • When you copy a Zulip link and paste it anywhere that accepts HTML formatting (e.g., your email, GitHub, docs, etc.), the link will be formatted as it would be in Zulip (e.g., #channel > topic.
  • To link to a topic in the channel you're composing to, you can now just type #> followed by a few letters from the topic name, and pick the desired topic from the autocomplete.
  • There's a new compose box button for creating a collaborative to-do list.
  • You’ll now see a typing notification when someone is editing a message, not just for composing new messages.

Web and desktop updates

  • You can now choose from a wide range of font size and line spacing options, to make the Zulip interface feel most comfortable for you.

We make many improvements to Zulip beyond what we can share here. Learn about additional feature highlights, and other Zulip project updates since July 2024, in the blog post announcing today's release of Zulip Server 10.0.

• You can now configure whether notices sent when topics are resolved are automatically marked as read for you.
  • You can now restore deactivated groups and archived channels if you need to use them again.

Starting this week, you’ll get Zulip’s next-generation mobile app the next time your Zulip app is upgraded. The new app offers a sleek new design and a faster, smoother experience. Check out the announcement post for details and how to share your feedback.

whoah! new zulip app!

looks pretty nice, but how do i search for a topic or channel? feels like i have to learn how to use this thing again.
Search is currently in progress, tracked in #mobile > search and supposed to be released by next week.
So.. just a quick question... is it intentional that all of our emails are essentially public to each other on here? :grimacing:

I doubt it's intentional :sweat_smile:
In Settings -> Account & privacy, under Privacy, last item for me is Who can access your email address and I have Admins only selected. I guess Nobody or Admins only should be the default in our case, but I don't know whether that's something admins can change on their side and who will that apply to (probably only new members).

I've recalled I have a toy Zulip cloud instance, so I checked. Under Settings (Organization) -> Default user settings -> Privacy settings it can be set to any option available to user themselves. It says on top "Configure the default personal preference settings for new users joining your organization." so this will only change the setting for new members.
we should probably set this :see_no_evil: is there a way to tag mods on here?
Only directly, if I'm not mistaken. @Jerod Santo, @Adam Stacoviak :wave:
Oh wow. That is not a great default setting.
ok switched the default to "Admins and moderators" thanks for the heads up @Chris Manson @Maroš Kučera
All credit goes to Chris. Judging from the fact I already had the setting changed before, I must have found it a long time ago and changed it, but not raised it as a potential improvement :innocent:
i think the default only applies to new signups, I wasn't aware of this visibility setting until seeing this thread and noticed mine was still public
Is there a way I can mass-edit everyone's setting and make them private? Or do I send out an email telling folks about the setting? What's the best move here?
is there a way to ask Zulip to help?
Probably! @Alya Abbott can you help with the above discussion? :point_up:

We should be able to do a mass-update for you. Probably makes sense to just update users who never changed the setting, and only to make it more restrictive (not less).

Can you email support@zulip.com with info on what you'd like the setting to be updated to (e.g., nobody can see emails, only admins can, etc.)?
We're also updating the default configuration to make it be contingent on what type of organization you have.
The current default makes sense for teams but less so for communities!

• You can now schedule yourself a direct message reminder about a message you want to come back to.
  • Permissions to move and resolve topics can now be configured separately for each channel.

Mobile updates

We've been hard at work adding the most highly requested features to the next-generation mobile app released in June.

  • You can now search for messages in the mobile app.
  • You can now see other users' availability and status, and toggle invisible mode.
  • You can check who reacted to a message, and when each message was sent.

Web and desktop updates

  • There are two new options for where you navigate by clicking on a channel name in the left sidebar: a list of topics in the channel, or the top unread topic.

• Zulip's topics help you keep conversations organized, but you may not need topics in some channels (e.g., a social channel, or one with a narrow purpose). For these situations, you can now configure “general chat” channels without topics.

Web and desktop updates

  • When viewing all topics in a channel in the left sidebar, you can now filter topics by whether they are resolved.
  • Your home view menu now has an option to mark as read all messages in muted topics or topics you don't follow. Zulip is snappier when you don't have thousands of unread messages.

• Administrators can now organize channels into folders (e.g., a dedicated folder for a team's channels), and sort folders as needed. Channels are grouped by folder in the Inbox view, and each person can decide whether to group channels by folder in the left sidebar.
  • Administrators can now configure a custom welcome message for new users. For example, you can describe the purpose of important channels, and link to your guidelines for using Zulip.

Web and desktop updates

  • A new filter in the upper left lets you filter everything in your left sidebar.

Mobile updates

  • You can now set your status.
  • Android users can now share files and text from other applications into Zulip.
  • You can now check who has read a message.
  • You will now see autocomplete suggestions for mentioning user groups, as well as users.
Awesome. Too bad only moderators can create folders though. Channels section of zulip does need a little work.

We make many improvements to Zulip beyond what we can share here. Learn about additional feature highlights, and other Zulip project updates since March, in the blog post announcing today's release of Zulip Server 11.0.

The help center has a new, modernized design, complete with light and dark theme. A search bar makes it easier to find the information you need, whether it's how to get started, specific features, best practices, or administrative capabilities.

Mobile updates

  • You can now browse channels you're not subscribed to, and subscribe.
  • You can now delete messages, if you have permission to do so.
  • Android users can now paste an image into a message, or insert a sticker from the keyboard.
